text:
F: thin, white, average retention.
C: gold, light hazy.
A: malt, citrus, grapefruit, grassy.
T: malty, grapefruit bitterness, tangerine, grassy, hint of tropical fruits, medium body, medium carbonation, very nice, enjoyed, half pint @ The Black Horse Inn pub near Horsham.

Pint on cask. An excellent golden ale. It lives up to its name, with a good amount of hop flavor at the end, but its also balanced and never overpowering. Great flavors of grapefruit and flowers that really come out at cellar temp.

Cask, Mariners Great Yarmouth. 
Pours golden amber with thin frothy lasting head. Decent aroma of hops, grapefruit and some hints of malt. Initial taste of grapefruit and a slight hint of grass leading to a slightly bitter, but somewhat refreshing aftertaste. Light carbonation. Not at all bad and easy drinking. Plenty of flavour for 3.8 ABV.

2016 catch up - Bottle at home - A nice easy drinking light bitter. Light hops and malt and very thirst quenching. I served it on the cool side and that was perfect. It is one of my favourite summer beers.
Cask at JDW gatwick north terminal. Golden clear pour with white head. Citrus grapefruit hops biscuits light malt. Good solid stuff

Tap @The Bridge Inn, Bristol.
Medium white head, golden/yellow colour, cloudy. Aroma of grapefruit peel, citrus, herbs. Bitter taste, light body, average carbonation, long finish. Nice, light and refreshing.

Cask at Harp in London. Beautiful clear bright pale golden with a lazy one-finger white head. Aroma is hoppy, floral, elderflower, citrus. Flavor is nice, dry, crisp, pale malt with a good hop punch. Light on the feel and drinkable with a nice soft carbonation. Really awesome for the blond ale style.

One of my favourite easy-to-drink golden ales, and as its 3.8% you can easily drink it all night. Not a particularly intense flavour, but a delicious one... although nowhere near as hoppy as the name implies.
Cask at the crown Eastbourne. A really solid golden ale and Im really pleasantly surprised at the abv. Incredibly drinkabls, light, with flavour. Yum.

Clear golden color with a white layer on top. Moderate intensity in the aroma. Nice body for a 3.8% beer. Soft to average carbonation level. Felt quite fresh and fine to drink. Good condition. Citric, herbal, fruity and malty flavor. Nice session ale![Handpull at Orange Tree in Chelsford, England]

500ml bottle. Clear golden appearance with a thin white head, poor retention, no lacing. Aroma: surprisingly malty, caramel, some citrus fruit. Taste is again quite malty, sweet caramel, citrus fruit, floral, hop bitterness in the finish. Medium body, smooth oily texture, quite well balanced. Easy drinking and certainly sessionable.
When you call your beer "Hophead" this is not at all what I expect - a little misleading and disappointing in that respect because hops just arent prominent enough to warrant such a descriptor, I mean its actually nicely balanced, anyway its not bad.
Bottle bought from Marks and Spencers, delicate hop edge, citrus favours. Very refreshing summers day session drink.
500ml bottle from M&S. Pours a very hazy straw colour. Aroma is sweet caramel and yeast and the taste is medium sweet with pithy and elderflower notes. Very good light ale.

Cask at PoW, Farnborough. Hoppy floral aroma. Light gold. White head is on the thin side. A hop bitterness, although there is sweetness seeping through the cracks. Light and watery. A softness to the mouthfeel. Long, if muted, mouthfeel. Decent enough.

Cask Pint at The Trafalgar, South Wimbledon, London in Mar 2010 - Pale yellowy gold in colour. Very Fruity; grapefriuit citrus. Hoppy; grassy and flowery hops. Malty base; caramel, sweet malts. Strong, citrus flowery, grassy, hoppy aroma and taste. Refreshing and flavour packed. Good fruit/hop/malt balance. Sweet leading to a dry hoppy bitter finish. Another great Dark Star beer. (2010-03)

Couple of pints at the Old Fox Telling. Bright Gold with a white mousse of head. Citric and tropical aroma. Grapefruit and tropical flavour, hint of cat pee, digestive biscuit. Zesty palate. Very refreshing.

Aroma:

Slight/medium aroma of malts, honey, fruit, hops and citrus.

Appearance:

Clear/hazy golden/amber beer with a slight/medium white head.

Taste/Palate:

Starts medium sweet with malts, honey and fruit; ends slightly bitter and dry with hops and citrus.

Overall:

This beer is rather intense, complex and balanced. Decent beer overall that does nothing wrong, but does nothing great at the same time. The aroma could have been stronger though.
Bottle. Golden with a small head.Clear appearance and slightly bitter. Not a lot of hops presence which is surprising considering its name. Typical CAMRA type session beer. Boring and bland.
Pours a finger of head on a hazy straw body. Aroma is grains. Taste is lemon bitterness, dry overall. Texture is softer.
Big bottle from ales by mail. Almost clear gold to orange color. Thin white head. Medium bitterness, light sweetness. Thin body. Aroma is very floral, hops, malt, caramel.

Cask at Cask Pub & Kitchen, London. 
Golden, clear body, with a medium, creamy, lacing, yellowish head. 
Aroma of grass, flowers, some hay, citrus, slight tropical fruits, some biscuit. 
Tastes of citrus, grass, flowers, grains, some tropical fruits, some biscuit. 
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation. 
Finishes medium bitter, a bit dry, zesty, floral, grassy, a bit fruity, a bit sweet. 

Nice one. Very easy and fresh, with some nice grainy notes. Not as much hops as expected though. Not the best style example Ive had, but a well drinkable one.

Served in a tulip from a 500ml bottle. Pours clear golden colour with virtually no head. Aroma is grass, caramel, floral, hints of honey. Taste is grass, floral, medium bitter with a subtle bitter finish. Thin body with medium carbonation. Very refreshing and quaffable, will make a great session beer indeed!
Bottle in beer subscription box. Pours bright yellow with white head. Aroma hop-heavy with tropical and citrus fruits and lychee. Vanilla and biscuit aftertaste.

Pint at the Hope Carshalton. A: Golden, an initial haze cleared up to leave a clear beer, small head, a decent amount of lacing clung to the side of the glass. S: Strong hints of grapefruit. T: Sharp bitterness combined with hints of lime and grapefruit. M: Smooth, minimal carbonation, slipped down quite well. O: Lots of character and subtleness, outstanding session beer.

On tap @ Harp, London, UK. Pours with a golden colour, small white frothy head. Aroma is medium malty, with notes of bread, and medium hoppy, with notes of herbs; a bit faint. Taste is medium sweet, medium bitter. Medium to heavy body, creamy texture, soft carbonation.

Holiday, top-50 fun hunt. #-9. bright golden with a limited white head. Aroma of malts, straw, hay, grass, citrus, orange. Taste has some weak sour note in it, some citrus, malts, hops, medium bitterness, grain, quite fruity, grassy, low alcoholic beer with nice taste however im not that impressed.

August 12, 2015. Cast at Akkurat. 
Clear golden with a small frothy white head. Aroma is elderflower, grass, biscuit, citrus, minerals. Taste is light to medium sweet, light bitter. Finish is sweet biscuit, hints of peach, bitter grassy and floral notes with a touch of citrus. Medium bodied, creamy, soft carbonation. 
Very nice floral presence with fresh elderflower notes.

Bottle from M&S. Hugely disappointing. I've had this before on tap and quite liked it. This is quite awful. It's like they've tried to copy the nasty bottled Caledonian 80/-, succeeded, then gone to make it much worse. Nasty stuff.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Clear golden beer with a white head and a bitter citrus aroma. Tastes is bitter hoppy, grapefruit and lemon. Dry, tart finish. Could have gone being a mite cooler but night.

On gravity cask at the Yard of Ale in Broadstairs. Pours a golden color with an off-white head. The smell is citrus, toasted malt. The taste is toasted grain, citrus, some grapefruit, grass ending dry and slightly bitter. Quite light in body with very mild carbonation.

Cellars Alehouse, Maidstone

Dull, dull, dull. It lacked flavour, body, aroma and was thin and watery. Mentioning hops in the name is a misnomer.

Pours clear golden with low white head. Aroma of citrus, grapefruit, pine. Taste is light pine bitter with a soft sweetness before a lingering bitter finish. Light , smooth body with soft carbonation.

Tap. Aroma of citrus fruits and floral hops. Pours golden with white lace top. Tastes of tangerine mixed in flour with a bitter tang. The lingering bitterness belies the thin body and high carbonation. Gassy. And missing something.
Solid drinkable beer with a creamy aroma. Obviously wateriness is present to a certain extent but the yeasty and malty flavours do not compensate for this  ---Rated via Beer Buddy for Android

Thnx To Adam and Anna ! Pours clear blonde, very small white head. Smell is creamy hoparoma, cascade shines trough beautifully. Smell is bit bitter, very nice malty and yeasty profile. Nice crisypness. Good amount of hoppyness as well. beautifull session ale !
On tap. Clear golden with medium white head. Fruity aroma, hoppy. Sweet taste of caramel with smooth floral hoppy bitterness
Pint from cask into a mug in London. Light, clear, yellow, moderate white head. Dry, flat, bitter, herbal, a hint of fruitiness. The taste is pleasant, but the body lacks a bit.
On cask. Smooth malty and round beginning. Nice floral fresh piney hops on a malty Ale-body. Not much bitterness, round and fresh. Easy to drink with a mild ale-bitter finish!

Watery oily medium bodied balanced beer. Nothing to crazy. Just not that interesting. For the abv not bad though

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Håndpumpet på Kings Arms (Waterloo), før konsert i Festival Hall: klar, lys gylden med ok skum. Frisk og godt humlet med preg av citrus, blomster og appelsinmarmelade. Litt gress i avslutningen. En av de bedre golden ales.
Cask. Klar orange, medelstort vitt skum som inte är långvarigt. Dofter av citrus, persika och tall. Smakinslag citrus, malt, grapefrukt och karamell. Härligt fruktig avslutning med en lättare beska.

Cask @ Oliver Twist. Almost clear, golden with a creamy white head leaving rich lacing. Citrus fresh aroma, grapefruit and caramel. Mild carbonated, smooth light mouthfeel. Taste is citrus hoppy and herbal, some sweet notes, grass, hay. Grassy bitter finish.

Cask at The Hop Inn, Newcastle-Under-Lyme. A clear golden colour with a medium white head. Aroma of grapefruit, some orange, slight caramel and grassy, floral hops. Taste of grapefruit, some orange, a little peach, slight caramel and grassy, floral hops. Light bodied and soft carbonation. A dry, floral hop bitterness in the finish. A pleasant, hoppy golden ale, great for its ABV. Its good but not as good as most people think.

Cask at Holborn Whippet. Dark Star 3.8% hop head light golden ale

It pours a clear shiny gold from the cask with a thick head of foam. Happy citrus and honey graham cracker aroma. Smooth full mouthfeel. The taste is ascerbic, bitter and earthy with a definite English bitter type bent I wasnt expecting. Alright but not for me.
Lovely clean, refreshing full bodied session ale. So good we got a keg of it for our wedding

Keg at The Library, Durham, £3.70/pint.

Golden colour with thin white head. Citrus aroma and heavily hopped bittersweet taste. Smooth enough to drink several, very enjoyable.
Served at a local bar. Bright amber body with a low white head. Malty, with notes of grass, hay and earth.

500ml bottle from Tescos. Clear light golden beer with a nice lacey white head. Sweet citrus, grapefruit aroma. Carbonation is spot on making it enliven on the tongue. Well balanced flavours of pale malt backing the citrus, sprucey hop overtones. Slightly astringent dry sprucey, citrus rind finish. Refreshing and delicious.

500ml bottle from ales by mail. Golden amber in colour with a decent sized foamy white head. Full of hoppy and floral aromas. Flavours of tropical fruits, a touch grassy and bursting with hoppy bitterness. Great tasting session beer.

On cask @ Wenlock Arms, London - UK. Color: blond golden beer with no carbonation and small white foam. Smell: Hoppy and grassy nose, really fruity! Taste: small watery sensation, great malt and hoppy balance. Very nice beer, grassy and floral taste. Great sensation! Aftertaste: sweet bitterness and floral finish.

Cask @ The Old Red Cow in London


Appearance: Orange body, thin off white head

Aroma: Floral, grapefruit, toffee

Taste: Prominent floral notes, sweet toffee, some grapefruit 

Palate: Light body and bitterness
Pint on hand pull at Bree Louise. Floral hop nose. Still golden beer with small solid head. Light texture with big floral hop notes. Nice grapefruit bitter finish.

Bottle - light golden with a lively body and a small white head which fizzes away quickly. Aroma of apple, pear and caramel. Taste of peaches, apples and lemons with some grassy hints. Lots of honey comes through a little later. A little sweetness and caramel to end with light bitterness. Light body, medium carbonation.

Ideal summer session beer this. Slight breadiness up front and your thinking this might be a dull number but along comes a pleasing little bite of bitterness and subtle lingering floral hops. Would like to try the various hop variety versions.
Cask at the Southern. Pours golden yellow, nose is floral, taste is sweet toffee, floral.

Cask at local bar in Brighton. Clear golden with almost no head. Light to medium body with moderate carbonation. Nice subtle bitterness with some sweet tones. Pine, caramel, malts, tropical fruits and herbs. A great tasty brew.

Served from cask. Golden colour with a small white head. Lots of hops in the aroma, with notes of citrus, flowers, pineapple and passion fruit. Moderate sweetness and bitterness, with a long, quite dry and bitter finish. Nice, refreshing beer.

Cask half-pint in The Plough, Shifnal on 21st Jan 2015. Light golden colour with a small white head. Citrus hop aroma, light grapefruit and melon taste. Semi-sweet with a light body feel. Floral notes in the nose and taste also. Very easy drinking and in excellent condition.
Good beer, light floral hop aroma. Good mouth feel and very full bodied for a 3.8% beer.
A very good beer, bitter and alive with hops but not harsh. Lovely refreshing drink.

19/XI/14 - cask @ Stormbird (London) - BB: n/a (2014-1349) Thanks to Hannah for sharing the beer!
Clear light orange beer, small creamy off-white head, pretty stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: fruity, pineapple, passion fruits, citrus, bit sweet. MF: no carbon, medium body. Taste: fruity start, almost sweet, peaches, soft bitterness, malty touch. Aftertaste: bit grassy, grapefruit, soft bitterness. Nice refreshing and light beer. Lovely!

Backlog rating. Cask at CBC Clerkenwell, London. It pours a hazy golden color with a small white head. Aroma is intensely hoppy and fruity with fresh pineapple, mango and apricots. Some grassy flowery notes too. Taste is bitter and hoppy but not overly so, with some good fruity sweetness. Medium bodied with good carbonation. A well balanced pale ale

The aroma is light grass hop, citrus, light floral. The flavour is moderate bitter with a light fresh grass nettle hop light toothpaste bitter palate. Light bodied with soft carbonation. A little light and lacks defining flavours.
Cask. Pour is gold with a creamy head, aroma is fruity, sweet. Taste is fruity, earthy, strong bitter finish, body is thin, carbonation is gentle and texture is oily. Decent
My favourite local beer, and at session strength which means I can indulge freely.
Love it. Subtle new world hops notes. Light on alcohol. Refreshing. A great session beer.

Light, refreshing yet extremely hoppy - citrus, pine, woody. One for a hot summers day when a lager isn't rays enough.


Rated by BrewTom

Aroma: light citrus, some flowers. Appearance: slightly hazy, pale gold, small, creamy white head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: light body, flat carbonation, bitters continue, citrus zest, quite dry in the surprisingly long finish. Overall: nice Golden Ale, very refreshing aroma and palate. Pint at The Willow Walk, Victoria.

Fairly typical blond cask ale. Light and fruity, with a decent hop hit in the finish. Accomplishes not being one a bland blond ale. Its all in the description really; youve all had this one before. Gets the job done.
On tap at the Bracebridge Heath cricket club beer festival. Clear golden colour with a medium head. Aroma has fruity malts and hops. Flavour is malts with fruits and a hoppy finish.
Cask kings head Huddersfield.golden good white head lacing. Aroma is sweet fruity malts taste same good hoppy bitter finish. Medium body. Good golden.

Cask from deeside drinks emporium. Pours a clear, light yellow/gold with a small white head which fades. Aromas of light caramel, grass and hay with a light lime citrus note. A strong hoppy back bone which smooths out to leave a citrus finish. Watery mouthfeel. A nice easy beer to drink.
Tap, gold pour, white head, nose is sweet, citrus, taste is hoppy, bitter, floral, awesome.

Cask at The Kings Arms, RBESG 
Dark golden with a medium sized off-white head, good lacing. Aroma is floral. Flavors are floral, dusty and citrus 
Decent
Clear golden colour, white head. Aroma of floral hops, straw, floral hops. Malty flavour, light straw, earthy hops, light bitterness. Malty finish, floral, bitter.(draught @ Harp, London)
Cask - Light grapefruit hops and some mellow malts. Clear gold with a small head. Earthy hops and a dry bitterness that lasts throughout. Easy drinking and decent.

Cask at the Lord Northbrook, Lee. An old favourite this one, thought it was about time I rated it.... bright gold pour with a white head. Lemongrass, grapefruit, straw and orange pith aroma. Heavy hop tang, lots of bitter citrus. Long hoppy finish.

On tap in Eastbourne. Nice hoppy nose with some fruits and vanilla. Easily drinkable with some hops, malt and unripe fruits. Good one without becoming exceptional. Was beaten by the other Ale we tried at that pub.

On tap at The London and County in Eastbourne. Pours out in a hazy golden colour with low ehad and flat body. Aroma of fresh hops, spruce and oak. Taste of fresh hops, coriander, thyme, herbs, citrus fruits and spruce. Dry and medium bitter finish. Enjoyed it a lot.

On tap at Counting House, Glasgow (JDW)
Pretty standard fare. Well kept and poured. Light golden colour. Decent lacing but everything else is just ok. Bit disappointing really.
smells like stale hops. pale gold thin wihite hint of a head. tastes like a bland version of oakham JHB.

A bright golden beer with a weak white head. A light, grassy and fruity hop aroma, there is a background maltiness that does have a hint of honey! Light, dry mouthfeel. An immediate tart hop flavour, grassy and pithy citrus fruit, limes and grapefruit, then the slightly honeyed malt element comes through. A long and tart finish. Tasted at the 17th King's Lynn Beer Festival, Stuart House Hotel, King's Lynn, Norfolk.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

How: Cask.
Where: Akkurat, Stockholm.
Appearance: Pale golden colour with a white head.
Aroma: Fruit, hops, grass, citrus.
Body: Medium body, low carbonation.
Flavour: Fruit, metallic, citrus. Bitter finish.
Cask at the Jolly Coopers, Epsom. Pale side of gold with a white head. Hoppy aroma, a little grapefruit. Bitter finish. Super session ale.
A pretty standard beer, on draft at evening star, brighton. Hoppy, golden yellow, not very carbonated.

Bona cervesa, es bastant equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, es bastante equilibrada y sabrosa.

UPDATED: MAY 22, 2015 500 ml from handpump at Birra+. Rich pale gold, quite clear, with a big, frothy and bubbly white head. Grassy, hoppy and herbal nose, some light cereals and white bread presence. Incredibly smooth and refreshing, so easy to drink. Perfect level of bitterness (quite low), persitent hoppy and fruity taste. Mild malty backbone. Soft carbonation, light body, creamy texture. Superb session beer. *** I rarely update beers but Hophead deserves to be an exception. Such a superb beer no matther what! From 4 to 4.2 ***
Color dark yellow with small white head. Aroma weak some citrus, yeast. Taste some bitter, peach, hop.
Ljus färg och något grumlig med vit skumkrona. Söt men den övertas av en härlig beska, väl balanserad.
En av det bättre lågalkohol ölen jag druckit. Fruktig kanske ananas i aromen. Riktigt len och balanserad i smak och kropp.

Keg @El Lúpulo Feroz, Oviedo.04-06-2014.
In short: a fresh herbal ale.
Pours clear golden with frothy white head. Moderate head retention, some lacing. Malty, yeasty, herbal aromas. Light body, average carbonation, slightly crispy texture. Taste is herbal, mild bitter, some dry. Smooth and enjoybale.
0,5l in cask @ St. Urhos Pub. Pours clear golden with a medium head. Aroma is fruity malts. Flavor is malts with plenty of fruits and a hoppy finish. Well balanced and refreshing. Good summer beer.

Keg at Oliver Twist.
Nice drinkable brew with a light solid malt base and a balanced fresh hoppyness.

Cask at JDW. Light amber shade with a white head. Not as hoppy as I expected but does have some nice tangerine and passion fruit characteristics. Smooth caramel underpinning. Refreshing drop but doesnt stand out as much compared to the other Dark Stars Ive tried.
Cask at a Wetherspoons. Nice bitterness to finish. Head dies down quickly. Not much on the nose. Light summer evening pale ale.

UPDATED: JAN 23, 2015 2014-05-13: 3+7+7+3+15=3.5.Cask. Light hazy yellow with a small white head. Pretty crisp and hoppy with notes of grass, citrus, forest, golden bread crust, straw. Medium body, oily texture, near flat carbonation, light/medium sweet and medium bitter. Dry hoppy finish. Refreshing and easy to drink.


Again! Cask. Clear golden with a small frothy good lacing white head. Wooden, dried green plants, hay, light white bread. Pleasantly hop driven with some filling malty sweetness that works well with solid bitterness. Light acidity. Long dry finish. Refreshing and well constructed.
really easy drinker very refreshing good amount of hopps a really well rounded beer

At May.B Rome. Pours clear yellow with a huge foamy head. Nose of flowers, grass and lemon. Mouth: session beer. Extremely refreshing and bitter: bread malts, bitter notes and citrus. Excellent golden Ale!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
At BBF. Golden colour with white head. Malt, honey aroma, also some hops. Malty, hoppy taste, also honey, bitter and sweet. Light body.

Very hoppy aroma. Light honey colour. Very pungent taste. Strong on the tongue. American style. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Smells nicely hoppy. A little cloudy (tasted at Eden beer festival). Hoppy up front. Nicely bitter after taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Cask @ Harp (Greater London). Clear golden with a small white head and good lacing. Aroma is hoppy with grapefruits/citrus, mineral notes and light herbal presence. Taste is the same as aroma with a little more grassy notes and a light but sticky herbal bitter finish. Light body. Low carbonation. Sticky. Nice earthy blond ale. Drinkable and refreshing.

Draft at Good Companions, Brighton. Pale gold, large mug, nose all hops. Great balance bitter and flowery hops, mouthfeel low carbonation but fantastic flavor. Loved it. Fit the mood - sunshine, sunday roast, great bitter.

text: On cask @ blackdoor. Yellow colour. Pale malts, fruity grapefruity hops. Well bittered, light but not watery. Pretty nice thirst quencher . This one did have a bunch of eggy sulphur on it, but otherwise a nice smooth light tasty brew.

UPDATED: FEB 8, 2016 Appearance- light and hazy, golden with a small head. Aroma- big hops, zesty, fruity. Taste- some carbonation here, all about the hop bitterness, a bit of tangy lemon/orangey. A nice ale overall.

Bottle. Appearance- golden, slightly amber, clear with a few bubbles rising, a small, quickly-disappearing white head. Aroma- fresh, citrus fruit, cut grass, elderflower, hop resin, grapefruit, pine, tangerines, malty hints. Taste- creamy malt backbone, hops, bitter zesty fruit, pineapple, clinging bitter finish. Very nice and well-crafted.

Pompa @ Ma Che Siete Venuti a Fà.
Chiara un pelo torbida con bellissima schiuma.
Carbonazione a zero, amara e beverina, mantiene quello che promette al naso!

Cask in the Prince of Wales, Farnborough. Pale golden coloured with a frothy white head. Sweet at first before a bitter tropical fruit finish with grapefruit and pineapple. A refreshing and sessionable brew. Just a little thin perhaps.
Pale ale à langlaise, sèche, citronné, très aromatique pour seulement 3,8%. Goûtée au fût.
On tap at Cask Pub & Kitchen in London. Flowery and hoppy with a light malty body. Very easy to drink.

Pale golden colour, good head. very hoppy aroma. good balanced bitter, just a touch of light malt, and something of a dry flowery hop flavour with a hint of citrus. Dry and moderately bitter, medium moreish finish.
Cask. It smells very fruity (grapefruit). The beer has no head, the body is dark orange-red. The taste is bitter and fruity. The body is medium strong and creamy with a flat carbonation.

Cask @ Guide Dog, Southampton. Mid-gold, tiny white head. Full hoppy aroma: grapefruit (Cascade?) and less definable citrus. The taste is pleasant but falls short of the taste bud utopia suggested by the aroma. Slightly too bitter, unbalanced and a bit soapy. However Hopheads is still a great pint from one of Britains best producers of cask ale.

[10/3/13] Cask at Craft Beer Co Clerkenwell in London. Clear golden. Aroma of fruity hops and a bit of farty notes. Rather dry flavor with fruity hops and a moderately bitter finish. Rather light-bodied. Refreshing.
Clear golden with small white head. Aroma is malt, fruit, hop and a little citrus. Flavour is malt, fruit, hop, little citrus, little bitter, little grass, little dry an a little sweet.
Nice head with good duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are fruits, grass, straw, malt and hops. Dry bitter finish

Cask @ Southampton Arms, London. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of malt, grass, flowery hops, citrus. Flavor is malt, grass, flowers, citrus, light grapefruit. Medium body, soft carbonation, bitter finish. 180913
Light and hoppy. For the ABV this beer punches well above its weight. This is a great session beer. Not to be missed.

Cask. Pours pale golden in color woth a small head. Grapefruit, some biscuit and bits of summer meadow in aroma. Slightly skunky notes too. Nice, soft and smooth mouthfeel. Light grapefruit softcake in taste. Just a bit of grapefruit bitterness in finish.-- bb/wp

Cask sampled @ St. Arnolds Day Beer Festival 2013, The Old Wine Vaults, Faversham. 
Clear golden body with a small white head. Delicious citric aroma with light pale malt. Flavor is smooth, light malty, refreshing citric fruity and decent bitterness. Medium to thin body and refreshing in the aftertaste as well. Quite impressive for a 3,8% ale.
Cask. Creamy white good mostly lasting head. Yellow colour. Moderate malty and hoppy aroma. Heavy bitter flavor. Long heavy bitter finish. Grape notes. Creamy palate.

On tap at Akkurat, July 2013.

Clear golden with a small white head. Light and refreshing with malt, grass, tea and some earth. A pleasant one.

My Bottom Line:
On the softest cushion of straw-like cereals converse citrusy, leafy and coniferous hops, a harmonious moment which is so comfortable you dont want it to ever end.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A mole hill of white foam produces lots of lacing around the misty gold.
-The mouthfeel on this one is a 6 out of 5. The amazing cellaring job at The Harp and The Evening Star helps too.
-The flavour dosage is just perfect for a quencher. Subtle enough to make you want more and more, intense enough to make you smile after every sip.
-Drinkability is through the roof.
-The finish is to die for. All ingredients converge, a tightly-woven tapestry of flavour that lingers on the palate until you are compelled to the next gulp. And a large gulp its going to be
-From a North Americans point of view, the name of this beer may be misleading. This is not a hop bomb or a low gravity version of an American IPA. Its just the perfect conceived quencher, from both the malt AND hop fronts.
-Is this Unetice 10 of England? It may very well be
-The pints I had at The Edgar Wallace and The Evening Star were still excellent, but not the world beater I fell in love with at The Harp. Went back to The Harp three times over the course of 2 weeks and it was a world-beater every single time!

On cask at The Harp, The Edgar Wallace and The Evening Star.
Good beer, light floral hop aroma. Good mouth feel and very full bodied for a 3.8% beer.
On tap @ Craft Beer, Islington. Pale golden with a small white head. Fruity and flowery tones. Fruit, malt and citrus. Medium to light body with a long bitter finish.

Cask @ Gallows Bird, Espoo

Pours golden orange with a smooth bubbly head. Aroma of grassy hops, fruits, citrus and pine. Taste is smooth, hoppy and refreshing with notes of grassy hops, pine, citrus and fruits. Finish is bitter, grassy and hoppy. Good, easy going and nicely hopped session ale.

Cask @ harp. Pours clear golden with a white head. Not much carbonation. Great hoppy aroma. A little watery. More hops on the flavour, some lemon, grapefruit and nice amount of bitterness. Tasty.

pint. pours light gold with white head. aroma is great of fruit, flowers and hops. taste is great too. very light and drinkable. very fruity and hoppy.
A fantastic hoppy light coloured ale. Brewed in sussex approx 3.8. An absolutely great session beer.

Golden pour with minimal head. Aroma was lots of citrus, slightly floral. Big citrus taste and good lingering bitterness.
Cask,hand poured at Waggon & Horses,Halesowen.17th february.Pale gold pour with minimal head.Hoppy aroma with citrus hints.Taste same as aroma making a light and refreshing beer.
Cask at Angleterre, Helsinki. Appearance: Golden with small thick white head. Aromas and flavours: floral, fruits, grass and hops. Pretty dry.
Straight from cask at The Orange Tree, Chelmsford. True to its name, a very hoppy, easy drinking beer. Golden yellow, little head, and light body. Very good overall.

Cask ale tasted at Kittys 0.25L. Mild malty nose. Pale head (6mm). Slightly hazy pale golden colour. Dry hoppy slightly grapefruity taste. Also hints of leon. Quite hoppy one. Hoppy bitterness at the end.
291112. Tadp at the Blythe Hill tavern, London. Pours hazybgolden with a small head. Aroma hops, fresh barley. Nice hoppy taste. Low palate. Not Bad.

Cask at Craft Beer Co. Thanks to harrisoni for the nudge to try this one, as it was really very nice. Appealing pale gold pour, with a modest earthy look to it and plenty of zesty carbonation. Dry citrus, some flowers, and grass in the nose, just my flavor. Bright, prickly mouthfeel suits the beer well and the flavors are similarly buoyant, with loads of complexity and personality for such a low ABV beer. Well done.
Cask at Post Office Vaults, Birmingham.  Pale yellow ale, hoppy, dry, drinkable, grassy, malty, citrusy, smooth.  Nice.

UPDATED: APR 9, 2016 Cask at Draft House Charlotte, served in old school ale mug. Pale golden colour, not so much of a head. Tantalising hoppy aroma. Very well balanced bitter, just a touch of light malt, and something of a dry flowery hop flavour with a hint of citrus. Dry and moderately bitter, medium finish. Has the character of the moreish dry English golden bitter and does it well. 

Re-rate March 16. Previous score was a bit stingy.

Up from 3.3 > 3.4

Cask @ Holyrood 9A 280912 7/3/7/3/13 3.3

Pint at bonaccord. Pours clear golden. Lovely floral aroma with elderflower and hint of vanilla. Abit bitter citrus/grapefruit taste. Nice and refreshing pint but slightly lacking in complexity.

Lovely aroma. Taste is very bitter and full for this ABV. Slightly let down by an underlying sourness and overalls mouthfeel. But again at this ABV what do you expect? Really good session beer.

text:
Quallity golden ale, very light in coulor with a nice citrus aroma.

Had quite a few at a birthday party, the only downside is it does leave quite an acrid taste if you stay soley to that one beer all night.
Draught at bar. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with caramel, fruits. Smooth, yet very tasty. Excellent for warm summer days.

Deep gold, thin head; grassy citric new world hops in both the taste and the dry, bitter finish; full mouthfeel, particularly given the strength; hops all the way - certainly does what it says on the tin and achieves what it sets out to achieve; whilst Id prefer something a bit more balanced, but theres no denying this is a well executed modern pale ale.

One of the best English style IPAs Ive had.  Flowery aroma, some grass flavor and a sharp and tangy aftertaste.  Weak bodied with a watery mouthfeel but this is not at all a bad thing.  Golden and clear.  Tried with the parents in London in 2012.
Cask at the Webb Ellis JDW in Twickenham. Golden, hoppy, aromatic, light yet flavoursome and crisp. Refreshing and tasty.
Ehhh...no much here. Light hoppy bitter and slight sweetness. Underwhelmed.

[cask at the Caley Sample Room, Edinburgh] Clear golden beer, thin white head. Looks beautifully inviting. Gentle citrus grapefruit aroma  although the hops definitely let you know they are in there. The taste is glorious - bitter lemon, balanced beautifully by a rising sweetness. Those bitter citrus hops come through on the finish as a final burst of grapefruit. A classic [12042012]

Poured with almost no head, light haze. Citrus hops but moderate. Very light and an accessible body as well, as can be expected from an ale under 4 percent. Essence of hops, grassy. Low carbonation. Nice. Old style English ale mixed with a modern hop character. (At the Cask Pub and Kitchen)

Cask, Ncl BF. Pale, fruity and creamy. Tangy and refreshing with lovely light citrus notes and a clean, lingering finish. Another one that makes you suck your cheeks in, the previous comment about it not being a beer to drink all night is fairly true aswell.
Very pale with good head and a massive citrus flavour followed by a strong bitter finish. A typical Anglo-American ale, I dont mind one once in a while, but would hate to drink it all night.

Cask. Pale yellow with a touch of haze. Crisp white head. Lots of sugary sherberty smells, like standing in a confectioners. Tastes like love-hearts steeped in lime juice. There's a malt in the mouth and a bit of grapefruit bitterness to finish. Nice drink.

Aver avuto la fortuna di gustarla direttamente dal cask, non capita tutti i giorni. É una superba Golden Ale dal colore miele di acacia, che sprigiona fin dallaroma sentori floreali gradevolissimi. In bocca si conferma questa sensazione di fiore del luppolo, ma anche pompelmo, mela Golden e una lieve nota di malto biscottato. Ps data la carbonatazione perfetta e la consistenza watery da assuefazione...
Cask at HWBF. Golden with bubbly white head. Grapefruit hops and a bitter finish. Decent.

i seem to be in the minority on this one. decent but not great.
the main component is a massive bitter finish. prior to that a whiff of hops and a gentle hoppy palate.  slight grassy flavour.
got quite excited when I saw it on the bar, but was left a little disappointed.

cask. old. bell. harrogate

Light pale gold with a lasting frothy head. Smells of citrus, fruity, hops and light greapfruit. Thin medium body. Citrus, hoppy and greapfruit. Some sweet malt. Lasting hoppy finish. Closer to an IPA. Sour

Cask at Cask & Kitchen. Clear gold with a cream
head. Aroma of citrus. Flavour is popcorn that leads to quite a sharp bitter hop finish. Unusual, but alright.

Amber colored pour. Slight off-white head with minimal lacing. Hoppy aroma with some strong malt backbone. Hoppy flavor with a big malt presence. Pretty good bitter. Would like some more malt in there, but you cant have it all.
Light golden with a thin white head.  Light grapefruit aromas and flavors.  Pretty watery.
Pale golden color, small white head. Floreal aroma, with hintsof grapefruits. Taste is bitter, some citrus and grapefruits again. Watery

06/09/2011 Brasserie 4:20 (cask). Bionda viva, chiara, lievemente torbida, con una leggera schiuma. Aroma intenso di luppolo, malto caramellato, con note di fruttate di mela. Si percepisce una luppolatura abbondante ma non invadente. In bocca perfettamente bilanciata, elegantissima, note dolciastre (malto e caramello) e amare (luppolo) con una punta di lieviti. Cask by handpump at Counting House, Glasgow - pours pale clear yellow with a small off-white head, citrus malt aroma, taste is bitter lemon with a prolonged dry and bitter finish

Half, from cask @Craft Beer Co, London.  A layer of white bubbles, upon a bright, light gold colored body. A doughy yeast scent up front, offset by weak and undistinct hop aroma. Medium malt body. Lots of yeast in the flavor. Pleasantly bitter all the way to the finish. Not very filling. Light watery in the mouth. Light bitterness in a quite short ending. Not very well kept. Or maybe I got the last remainder from the cask...
Cask. Golden blonde color.  Sweet, slight hoppy aroma. Not sure why its called hophead when its not and ipa. Not bad

Cask at major oak 27/12/11 poured a crisp golden yellow with white creamy head, masses of citrus and grapefruit on the nose witch follows through in the taste with a bright hop aftertaste excellent ale wish I could get it everywhere as a session ale
Pale body with an small head. Zesty lemon and floral nose. Hoppy. The taste is nicely bitter with a refreshingly juicy finish. Light body, bitter. Nice, but a little underweight.
cask at cask p and k. Yellow with thin white head. Floral citrus hop aroma. Similar taste. Bitter Finnish. Pretty good

On tap @ Thomsons Bar, Edinburgh. The nose has floral and grapefruit notes. The taste has more of the floral notes, but much more pine and grapefruit this time. The palate is light to medium in structure with a light zingy texture and a clean finish. Overall, a good example of a golden ale.

Tapped (@Old Brewery Tavern, Canterbury, Kent, U.K.): Pale golden, mid-sized lacy white head, moderate dry flowery-earthy nose; dry bitter flavour, pretty light bodied; lingering tart grapefruity and hoppy finish. Well, well.....

Draught: Light hazy, light golden color, low head. Hoppy nose, notes of grapefruite and cirtus, bitterness and citruspeel. Quite bitter and a bitter and herbal finish. Very nice ale with intensive notes of aroma hops.

Cask @ Craft Beer Co., London. Pretty clear yellow color, small vast white head. Smell citrus, hops, bitter and fruits. Taste hops, bitter, lightly fruity. Good full taste for a beer of only 3,8% ABV. Low to medium carbonation, medium body.

Tap @ The Harp. Pours pale golden with a small white head leaving some lacing. Nice fruity, floral, sweet and quite hoppy aroma. Flavor is a bit sweet malty, floral and well hoppy bitter. Finishes longlived bitter and a bit dry.
Cask at The Harp at Charing Cross.  Lovely light beer easy drinking session ale.  Lovely flavours
Very light in appearance, tart and fruity taste, very good on a hot summer evening

[Cask at the Three Crowns, Chippenham] Very pale gold, moderate lasting head and a moderate fizz. Bouquets of flowers burst forth throughout, with a hint of lemon behind.  Moderately bitter, maybe a little on the watery side but very refreshing.  Decent beer.
Pale blonde with citrus flavours and bitterness up front mellowing into a gentle malt sweetness and a bitter finish

On cask at Tomsons Bar. Pours a light straw colour with a thin white head. Nice floral hoppy nose with some honey and barley notes. Quite an easy drinking session beer. Fairly bitter with barley, grassy hops, pine and orange rind. Little oily mouth-feel.

Hoppy and grassy aroma, very typical to a golden ale. Flavour is also typical, some grassy hops and hints of spices. Very well hopped and enjoyable for a real ale.
Cask at Craft Beer Co. Lemony aroma with honey malt, creamy. Huge ass grassy hop flavor, lemon, big, big bitterness. Medium gold color. Refresing and tasty. body is light and thin. Grat hops.

On tap at Craft Beer Co, Clerkenwell. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma iof fruity hops, peach and citrus. Taste is light bitter hops, light on the palate, almost watery mouthfeel. Lingering moderate bitter aftertaste.

Hand pump @ The Craft Beer Co, London. Clear yellow pour with a small bubbly head. Aroma is very citrusy on the hops, herbal too, weed, almost a bit peppery and spicy, and event a hint of basement-like dank hop aromas. Taste has fresh hop bitterness, citrusy and weed-like, light malty pleasant beer to drink, but the hops have a slight astringency.
What a fantastic hoppy ale this is! A floral aroma, appearance may be let this down as it tasted superb, dry, crisp, refreshing. Id love to have it again

text: Cask @ Akkurat. Refreshing summer beer. Crisp, hoppy and very drinkable due to the low abv. Too bad that it has got some serious soap notes.

Cask at Akkurat, Stockholm, Sweden. Aroma is thin but there is some roasted notes and a slight grassy note in there. Pours a golden, slightly hazy colour with a thin foam. Taste is dry and crisp, slight bitterness and very refreshing. Given the low alcohol content this is a perfect summer beer. Mouthfeel is smooth, little carbonation.

Nice colour, golden with hop haze... Light fluffy white head. bready malt and biting leafy fresh resinous bitterness. grippy. Very floral and freshly baked bread nose. Honey and flowers. And orange peel. Salty and burtonised but soft and drinkable. Yum!  Could down a lot of this stuff. Only minus is a slight celery note - green hoppiness.
UPDATED: NOV 12, 2012 Birra da paura!!! Freschissima, luppolata al punto giusto, da bere e ribere senza pietà! Una delle migliori birre mai bevute al 4:20.
Superb aroma, really strong floral hop nose with a hint of citrus. Taste is dominated by hops, pleasantly bitter, goes down very easily. Good ale.

Cask at Cloisters. Pale amber with a thin white head. Biscuit, light citrus nose. Taste is bitter up-front, but with a smooth floral streak. Average so far but its all about the finish. Long and zesty, but never overpowering, sticks around for a good few minutes after each sip. And at 3.8% ABV the hop presence is incredible.
Excellent session bitter thats bursting with flavour. Strong floral aroma with a hoppy, slightly bitter taste. Very refreshing.

Cask. The Pub, Leicester. Thin white head, pale gold body. Citric, grapefruit. Bitter. Dry, light bodied, soft mouthfeel. What a ridiculously overrated beer. I constantly drink beers better than this.

Cask at the Red Lion, Preston, Herts. Pale straw with a tight white head; aroma of fresh hops; slightly earthy flavour with fresh green hops and some toffee and light citrus to finish. A pleasant, straightforward, light bitter.

Tap @ Cask Pub and Kitchen in London. Pours a light golden color with a small white head. Aroma is lightly hoppy with alot of floral notes, citrus and grassy hops, along with some sweet matls. Aroma is very summery with alot of the floral hoppy notes and some citrussy hops. I also get the sweet malts, but the hops are dominating. The body is light and refreshing with a slightly dry mouthfeel. Overall a pretty nice Golden Ale.
UPDATED: APR 3, 2011 Cask @ The 3rd Larbert Beer Festival. Pale yellow with a greenish tinge! Not much head. Biscuit aroma. Biscuit & citrus fruit flavour. Bitter aftertaste. Not bad.
Cask at The Harp, London. Served a bit too warm. Pale golden colour, low white head. Moderate hoppy and slightly citrussy aroma. Distinctly hoppy flavour with a nice bitterness throughout.

Cask at the Harp. Light gold color with great curtains of white lacing. Some floral and light fruit aromas.  Nicely bitter, with grassy and citic hops and some doughy sourness.  Dry and medium body.  Nice stuff.

Cask @ OHaras, Tampere.
Poured a clear yellow clour without a head. Aroma of citrus, hops and some flowers. Flavour of grassy hops, citrus, pale malts and some caramel. Light bodied with a weak but sweet and bitter finish. Quite good, though this cask isnt at its best anymore.
Cask. Pours a slightly hazy gold, with a decent off white head. Aromas of grass and citrus. Flavour is amazing, with grass, citrus, biscuit and orange rind. Nice bitter finish. Love this beer!

Cask at the Green Dragon, Croydon. It pours hay yellow with low carbonation and a thin white head. The nose is citrus fruits, hay, grass and farmyard. The taste is bread, earthy, grass and citrus towards the finish (lemon, lime and orange). Its light, crisp, smooth, uncomplicated and makes for easy drinking.
One of my favourite beers, the hoppiness changes with the seasons but is always very pronounced.

UPDATED: MAR 8, 2011 Cask @ Brasserie 4:20 (Rome) - What an elegance! This is the kind of beers I love! Aroma of hops and fruits with honey and caramel notes. Taste of hops, fruited, quite bitter, a little bit sourness, perfectly balanced with caramel, malt and honey. Low-medium body. Great!!

24th September 2007  Warning! Early amateur rating! Hoppy citrus beer. Fresh and fruity and comparable to Oakham JHB. Easy drinking and not too bitter.

Cask at The Harp, Covent Garden. Nice golden with an off white head, that, true to it being cask, disappears quickly. For a British beer this has a very distinctive hoppy aroma: loads of classic British hops makes one feel as if taking a stroll in a hop garden in Southern England.
On the palate the beer is lively (impeccably handled by the staff at The Harp), bursting with hops and a biscuity malty background. Super beer and one, that Id love to have as my session beer for a night at the pub.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2011 Cask at The Harp. Pours a clear yellow with a faint white head. Strong grass and dandelion aroma with some citrus. Flavor has barely any sweetness and is instead dominated by an intense earth and grass bitterness with more dandelion. There is some more modest citrus in the aftertaste. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Finishes with orange citrus sweetness and lingering grass bitters. Quite nice.

@ The Charles Lamb in London. Hazy gold is not the richest of hues but the lace is even and thick so it looks nice. Lovely big hop aroma! Matching hop juice flavors. Juicy palate, some mineral character. Great stuff, one of the best pints I had in London.
@TheWhiteHorseSW6 and @4:20. Very nice hoppy Ale with a very elegant hoppy nose and a intriguing yet simple flavour palette. Lovely bitter dry end.
(cask Eailing BF).  Nice and vibrant pale ale .   Nose is christmas  tree pines..grapefruit saps ..hops are singing in this ale.

Cask at Akkurat.
Pale golden. Small white head.
Citric, hoppy aroma.
Pleasant maltiness and a high, dry bitterness.
Cask at Akkurat. Pale yellow, bubbly white head. Hoppy, grassy aroma, fruity. Hoppy metallic flavor, some fruits. Dry hoppy finish.

Cask @ Angleterre. Poured clear golden color with a bubbly white head, nice lasting lacing. Fruity aroma. Flavour is citrus fruity and hoppy. Ends bitter. Light, very refreshing and clean. Really nice!

Real ale, inget skum, mörk bärnstensfärg, drucken på Hawkley Inn. Varm, svag men med ovanligt mycket humle i både arom och smak, lite bränd söt maltkropp, lite åt mild ale hållet men samtidgt frisk p g a humlemängden. Mycket fin.
Wonderfully quaffable ale. Great hoppy aroma, citrusy but not over powering. Ill have another please.

cask - Pours golden and mostly clear with a long lasting white head.  The aroma is mainly hops with a little fruit.  The flavor is moderately bitter with good, crisp hops and well balanced bready malty sweetness.  Its smooth, tasty, and very quaffable.

Heads up to Martin @ White Horse for mentioning it was on. Pretty boring aroma just mild floral notes. Taste was awesome. Full on caramel, good bitterness, citrus hops and butterscotch. A little doughy yeast but nothing ott. I was really impressed with this. Look out for it. Tap at White Horse beer festival.

From cask at Oliver Twist Stockholm. 
Deep golden colour, expected vahue head. Fruity aroma with citrusy, lemony features. Light bodied with floral, bit citrusy hops and (white-)bready maltiness. Light bodied and long bitter finish.

Cask @ Cask, Pub & Kitchen, London. Appears golden with a minimal white head. Caramel notes with floral hops. It comes together nicely, almost with a toffeeish mouthfeel. The end finishes hoppy good that lingers. A solid English blonde ale.
Cask. Pours yellow with white head. Taste is medium bitter. Palate has light body, creamy texture, average carbonation. Aromas have floral hoppy notes, light citrus and cereal, leather.

On pump @ 4:20....
bellissimo aspetto oro intenso, schiuma bianca e molto compatta, lintensità dei profumi è bassa ma i profumi di luppolo son netti e delicati...al palato è contraddistinta da una splendida leggerezza, da bassa carbonazione e un legggero e caratteristico amaro e...come suggerice fabrizio, un finale di tè verde spettacolare....birra splendida, leggera, rinfrescante e dissetante...

Cask at Angleterre, Helsinki. Hazy golden color. Perfumed aroma with raisiny and lemony hops as well as caramel. Fruity hop flavor with firm fruity bitterness with raisins, lemons, apple and some biscuity maltiness in the background. Hoppy mouthfeel. Not very beery, tastes more like a hop juice. Tasty ale anyway.
Cask @ RnH. Golden pour with white head. Couldnt smell anything on the beer. Bitter metal after taste, slight grain and hop notes.

Cask at Rattle n Hum: Pale light golden pour with a thin white head. Crisp and bright aroma- lemon zest and herbal qualities with a crackery dry malt background. Creamy mouthfeel- quite substantial for the low ABV. Beautiful flavor- has a solid crackery malt back- very dry throughout with a rich zesty/spicy hop character. A fantastic session!

Cask.  Pours a pale golden body with a white head.  Pine y earth tones, dingy malt bill with highlights of vinegar?  Thin and light, i suspect something went wrong with the filling of this cask or transit ect.  I finished the pint but i didnt enjoy it so much.
Cask. Pours light gold with a white head. Fresh floral hoppy aroma with just a hint of citrus. The flavor is well balanced with floral hops and light pale malts. Very good and very drinkable.

Cask at Rattle and Hum. Poured a medium clearish amber. A bit of a thin mouthful but the flavor is strong and intense. Some great citrus notes. Grapefruit juice with a wonderful malt balance. Nice bitter finish.

Cask at The Gallows Bird, Espoo, Finland.
Cloudy golden colour with almost no head.
Smooth hoppiness with pine and resin in aroma.
Sweetish hoppy flavour with some ash and wood. No much of an aftertaste.

From cask at the Rake. Pours clear and golden yellow with a small white head. Aroma is solid peachy and grapefruity. Bitter, fruity and mild malty base flavoured. Very crisp and vibrant hops flavoured yet also smooth and not overly hoppy. Bitter and dry finish.

UPDATED: NOV 11, 2016 Cask at Akkurat, Stickholm, Sweden. Shady golden, small white head. Herbal and floral hop aroma with a light fruity/bready maltiness. Light bodied, soft carbonation. Dry with nice long bitter finish.

UPDATED: MAR 22, 2010 Cask @ pub, Brighton. Light golden colour, white head. Aroma is soft malty. Flavour is hoppy and malty, with a hint of biscuit. Worth a rerate.

Rerate: Cask @ 2nd Larbert Beer Festival. Aroma has floral hops. Flavour of soft floral hops, malty backbone. Fairly bitter, slightly dry. Fruity finish. +.4

Cask at the Evening Star, Brighton England on 29th August 2009. Pale golden with a white effervescent head of foam. Exquisitely hoppy with floral aromas and well balanced grassiness in the main kick - this being offset by  soothing feelgood malt. Refreshing and easy drinking on a crisp, mildly textured mouthfeel. At the Evening Star, Hophead is served on its absolute best, and always knocks me sideways with its flavour at such a low strength. Superb and one of my favourite beers of all time.
Cask at GBBF 09, light gold with a bubbly white head. A good floral hop aroma. A mouthfeel that does a good job of balancing the hops and malt. The citrus bite increases through the swallow.
Cask. at GBBF 2009. Golden colour with white head. Aroma is citrus, hoppy, quite floral too. Taste is hoppy, crisp, grassy, citrus. Well balanced and refreshing.

Cask @ Wenlock Arms London. A clear golden colored beer, with a small white head. The aroma of hops, some bitter. Its grassy a little fruits like citrus. The taste is dry hoppy, a little bitter with some fruits like citrus. There are some sweets. The aftertaste is bitter, some sweets, dry and a little spicey.
UPDATED: APR 19, 2017 Hazy yellow with a small white head. Fruity and malty aroma with citrus, peach and pear. Sweet grainy and fruity flavour with citrus and a touch of pear, and a long hoppy finish
Light golden colour, light hoppy nose, intensely refreshing and totally drinkable. Always a winner this beer.

UPDATED: MAY 31, 2017 Draught at OT. Almost as light as  a lager. Realy nice foam for a hand pumped real ale. Small arom of flowers and yeast. Fresh citrus, fruity taste. Big drinkability.
Sampled at Cask & Kitchen, London.
January edition of the beer.
Small head. Typical pilsner yellow color. Fruity aroma with a small sulfur touch. A nice citrus touch. as always a big drinkabillity.

Fresh at the brewery in Sussex. A golden coloured ale with a reasonable white head. Aroma of hops. Crisp tasting hoppy ale with citrus taste. An incredibly tasty beer for such a low ABV. You can drink a gallon of this and feel fine the next morning!

Cask - The Butchers Arms, Herne. A golden yellow coloured beer with a fine and frothy, lasting white head. Nice sweetness on the nose with orangey citrus fruits and a grassy note. The flavours combine this citrus backbone with more grassy qualities as well as a delicate floral tone. Lightish body but packed with flavour. Crisp and refreshing with a lasting palate texture and bitterness as well as a warming sensation in the throat.

Gravity, Rugby 09. Brilliant yellow gold haloed with white. Sweaty fresh squeezed hop aroma suggesting grapefruit and lychee. All that in the mouth with lingering oaty vanilla, digestives, rabbit hutch. Sweaty and bulbous at the strength. Classic festival opener.

UPDATED: NOV 10, 2010 [1885-20081206] Cask. Burlap hops grass aroma. Clear, medium orange brown body with quick white bubbles. Grassy hops flavour is not particularly bitter, long finish. Medium body. Enjoyable, packs some punch with flavour, not alcohol. (6/2/8/3/15) 3.4
(@ Coles; Buffalo, NY)

[3229B-20100801] Cask. Fruity hops and straw yeast aroma. Clear, light yellow orange body with a long-lasting foamy white head and spotted lacing. Mild bitter, great fresh hops and yeast flavour profile with a hint of citrus lemon in the finish. Medium body. Great brew, and popular this night too. (7/4/8/3/15) 3.7
(@ Wenlock Arms, London, England)

Cask @ London Drinker 25:

Really pale with a cute white lace.
Big grassy hops on the nose with heavy underlying honey. Quite petrolly.
Big flavours. Hops and cereals fight head-on whilst a tickly bitterness yeilds to mellow hay only to reappear in the back of the throat. All underpinned by tangy marmalade.
Thin and a little grating on the tongue.
Good flavours, if a bit in-your-face. Its a little hard on the inside of your mouth though.
Cask Salopian Bar - Golden yellow with a striking cascade hop aroma. Very clean with an abundance of flavour for a beer of its gravity.

Buffalo cask festival. Appearance: Light yellow with a slight haze. Small white head. Aroma: Nice grapefruit/hop aroma with some sweet cherry too. Flavour: Malty hop, nice juicy/bitter mouthfeel and a long dry finish. Nice.

Cask at Rattle n Hum.  Pours a light golden with a slight fluffy white head fades a bit.  Aorma is lightly hoppy- on the grassy side-0 and a bit herbal with crackery light pilsner/pale malts and a slight mineral catty thing going on.  Flavor is doughy, some crackery malts, herbal and grasy hops with a light fruity ester - pear and light malts in the end.  Somewhat crisp and fairly clean overall.
Cask at Brew Head, London. Golden body, slight head. Mild aroma. Lighter fruits, Grapefruit and Citrus definitely. Crisp. Smooth.

Cask at Coles & Mr. Goodbar Cask Event, Buffalo, NY. Pours a slightly hazy yellow-gold with a spare diminishing white head. Very nice resiny hop aroma -- better then expected. Flavour, also hoppy, is a touch watery and a little simple but still tasty. Light bitter finish. Average bodied. Pretty good, and a good light start to the festival!

2008-12-06. Very lightly hazy golden yellow body, near headless. (3+) Aroma is mild but pleasant, hops, melange of mild citrus. (7+) Flavour is likewise on the mild side, but with a pervasive hoppiness that is lightly muddled, pleasantly so, (7+) Average to light palate feels thinner due to the very light carbonation. Fairly mildly flavoured overall, but at this low an abv, its pretty darned impressive. Lovely session brew. Cask at Coles, Buffalo

Cask at Rattle n Hum. Nice hoppy, fresh aroma, even after making it across the Atlantic in a cask. Chewy and clean, crisp flavor, a bit muddy and unfermented finish. Very yeasty. Nice body. Kind of sweaty.

Handpulled cask at the Mermaid, St. Albans. I, have  enjoyed this beer in many pubs and find it hard to believe Ive not rated it yet. Pale gold with a thick white head. Lovely fresh citrus hop aroma. Stunning flavour of fresh american type hops with grapefruit and sherbert. A fantastic session beer..

Cask at Coles/Mr. Goodbar Cask Fest.

Aroma is wet, leafy hops, a fine malt reveals itself too, hazy amber. Taste has a fresh fruity compliment to the leafy hops and malt. Light bodied, excellent balance, completely easy to drink. As good a session ale as Ive had in a long time.

On cask @ Coles & Mr Goodbar Cask Event. Pours a very light gold pour. Nice hoppy & fruity aroma. Taste is light hops, fruity & very flavorful for a 3.8% beer. Very easy drinking & the first cask to kick

Hand-pumped at the Wenlock arms in northern London.

Pours a clear golden amber color with a frothy white head.  Subtle hop aroma with slight pilsner malt presence.  This is a very smooth drinkng beer.  It is kind of watred down yet has a creamy characteristic with nice subtle soft hops.  Crispy, refreshing nice dry finish but not very bitter.

on cask @ Wenlock Arms (London).  I walked in, checked the badges, and "HOPHEAD" seemed picked out in neon - hel-LO!  Slightly hazy light gold pour with an average creamy white lasting head.  Very light aroma, but solidly herbal-hoppy backed by slightly sweet oily grain malt.  The taste - the same, even more bitter than I expected, and decently acidic - it went down very smoothly; and quickly.  The mouthfeel was oily and a touch light, moderately astringent over a soft, verly lightly carbonated base - the herbal hoppiness carries through into a welcome linger - this really takes its time finishing.
Cask, 4.8% at GBBF08. Weak hop aroma. Almost clear golden colour. Small stable white head. OK grassy hop flavour. The bitterness is a little rough. Not that hoppy, and not that good.

Cask (Guide Dog,Southampton) - Golden in colour. An incredibly enticing hoppy aroma with some grapefruit notes and a twist of lemon. Bitter and hoppy taste with tangy grapefruit and a lovely hoppy finish. Excellent, so much flavour for the strength. A superb beer.
Cask. Medium high white lasting fluffy head. Hazy yellow body. Mild and sweet fruity aroma. Dry hoppy flavor with low carbonation and a long bitter afrtertastdse.

Cask at The Butchers Arms, Herne: Clear golden yellow looking pint. Floral aroma with a little hop and citrus. This must be one of the most refreshing beers there is, so light and hoppy. Just a stunning beer really.

UPDATED: JUL 29, 2009 First rating(Cask at OT, Stockholm)On August 8, 2008Slight shady pale yellow color, small white head. Fresh, fruity, floral, a bit citrus hoppy scent. Bitter, floral hoppy taste. Light and smooth mouthfeel. Medium bitterness. Nice spicy lingering afterbitterness. Very drinkable!8/3/8/4/16=3.9rerateCask at OT on July 6, 2009Hazy golden color, white head. Malty sweet and fruity hoppy scent. Hoppy, bitter, fruity taste. Medium mouthfeel, medium high bitterness.7/4/7/3/14=3.5

Cask at Oluthuone Leskinen, Oulu. Orange to yellow coloured and cloudy. Thin but creamy, white head. Aroma has some yeast fruity notes ar first. Toffy maltiness with lots of woody but aromatic/floral hops in the finish. Bitter flavor with some sweetish toffy. Texture is a bit sticky bitter in the finish. Otherwise slick and low carbonated. Light to medium bodied. Long and bitter finish.

UPDATED: AUG 27, 2008 Cask at Oliver Twist, Stockholm. Golden yellow color with a small white head. Hoppy, citrusy, fruity and fresh aroma.
Taste of bitter hops, citrus, fruit and some bready malt. Light bodied and light carbonation. I could easily drink a lot of this one. Excellent session ale!

Cask at the Seven Stars, London. This is another excellent golden beer, with a smooth palate and lots of fruit flavours, both soft fruits and citrus. Dark Star is getting to be one of my favourite breweries.

Cask at the Doric Arch, Euston, London. Darkish gold color with a nice white head. Mild floral aroma. Wow! It is hoppy. Citrus and floral. Very light malt. Nice bitter finish. Meets the American standard.

(Cask at Gallows Bird on 2008-05-14) This is a beer with loads of hoppiness but still extremely smooth and balanced. Theres also a nice bready aroma going on. A very interesting real ale thats tasty and drinkable at the same time!

UPDATED: OCT 24, 2008 (Re-rate, cask at Gallows Bird, Espoo, on 2008-10-23) Golden. Clear. Small white head. Grassy aromas in nose. Light bodied palate with almost non-existent carbonation. Grass, bitterness, some malts and quite a bit of fruitiness in taste. Fruity and bitter aftertaste.


(Cask at Gallows Bird on 2008-04-09) Golden and clear. Small white head. Mostly hops in nose. Frutiy hoppy taste. Very light bodied. (Rating: 7-3-6-2-12 = 3)

half pint in Gallows Bird Espoo. Pale yellow gold, almost clear. white tiny head leaving lace as it diminishes almost entirely. smallest bubbles rising from the bottom of the glass. did they cheat me in Gallows Bird? looks and smells, almost even tastes exactly like SIMA. Nice balance in favor of hops. sweet honey menthol. Milky smooth, not as flat as Real Ales sometimes are
cask at blackfriers-pours more yellow than the pale, smells cat pee, off milk, earth toffeed malts, tastes a bit salty hops up front but well balanced with big malts that lend a sweet hand.
half at the london drinker camden. Fruity malt inthe nose, looks of light straw, taste fresh, little bitter. Refreshing well balanced floral session beer.

cask 0,568l at Gallows Espoo 
color:bright yellow
scent:nice hobs
Taste:fresh real ale,strong hobs citrus
medium aftertaste
My all time favorite. Lots of flavor  so little amount of alcohol. Good session ale
Cask. Golden colour with white head. Aroma is citrus, hoppy, quite floral too. Taste is hoppy, crisp, grassy, citrus. Well balanced and refreshing.

Cask at the 7 Stars (excellent pub BTW), october 07. Shinny, golden color with a small white head that last for quite a while and leaves some lacing. Citric, piney, spicy aroma. Very perfumey. Spicy, citric, profound hoppy flavor with some pale ale malts notes and a tea like end. Very nice. Medium to light palate, very tasty and refreshing. Nice spicy hops aftertaste. Great for such a light beer. Amazingly drinkable and tasty hoppy golden bitter.

UPDATED: OCT 17, 2008 Cask (Gallows Bird, Espoo)
Light orange, persistent sudsy head. Huge dry peppery hop aroma. Light fresh body, pale malts and dry hoppiness. Long dry bitter finish  from the hops - some fruity, some citrussy. Great bite, good interesting summer bitter.
rerate of (6-2-8-3-13=3.2)
Cask (Helsinki Beer Festival 2004)
Pale gold, tiny head. Citrus and bitter aroma - hops quite distinct, almost resiny. Clean crisp taste. Refreshing summer ale.

cask at the 2007 Oxford Beer Festival. Pale gold in colour with strong aromas of resiny hops, cut grass, and flowers. Hop flavors dominate, with light citrus and cut grass elements. Some biscuit dry malts enter the picture near the finish. Quite bitter. A close second to Croch Vale Amarillo for my personal "Best in Show".
On tap at The Rake, London. Intense golden colour with a small frothy head. Refreshing citrus aroma. Great citrussy flavours, well-balanced bitterness. Refreshing.

Comments: Extremely drinkable, smooth bodied, foamy and hoppy, leafy ale. The quintessential tasty and drinkable session golden ale and probably the one with the best mouthfeel.
Citrus nose, amber in colour. Light/soft body. Heavily hopped - quitesimple but good. Similar to Crouch Vale Amarillo.
Huge aroma of flowers and hops. Taste is very watery of hops and more flowers.
Cask Blackfriars ...  Light gold ... soft hop nose ... very fruity very light and refreshing ... good session beer and palate freshner... nice floralness.

Cask (handpump) @ Wenlock Arms,  N1, Hoxton, London. Clear yellow orange color with a small, virtually none, fully diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is  moderate hoppy, flowers, citrus, grapefuit. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a long duration. Body is light to medium, texture is oily, carbonation is flat.
Cask, Wenlock Arms. Clear straw, thin white head. Fresh hoppy, some grass and lemon in there. Quite hoppy, sometimes a little harsh. Finishes a little maltier. OK.

Cask at The White Horse, Parsons Green. Pours a pale gold with little head. The taste and aroma are, unsuprisingly, dominated by hops with some citrus flavours. The finish is lingering and bitter making for a pretty refreshing pint.
cask-conditioned at Oliver Twist, Stockholm Golden with a low but dense head. Citrus and hops aroma. Somewhat watery but the growing bitterness really makes up for that.

UPDATED: MAR 24, 2009 Cask-conditioned at the rake, Borough Market 30/6/07. Pale Gold with a moderate white head. This packed in a huge amount of aroma and flavour for a sub 4% beer. Aromas of floral hops, lemons and hay. Flavour was powerfully  hoppy with a decent, dry finish. Excellent.
[Cask at Blackfriars] Lots of citric fruit, floral notes, some apricot notes and a little yeast. Light, spritzy body, lots of hops, dry finish. Awesome.

Cask at Doric Arch outside Euston Station. Fresh, bright and spicey hop aroma. Citric smell of orange, tangarine and passion fruit. Flavor has muted bitterness. Grassy hops, grapefruit flavors. Also, resinous and flavors of medicinal herbs. Aftertaste is all sussex bitter hop muscle. Very light beer with extreme hop bitterness.

Cask! Golden pour with big white head. Light fruit aroma. Flavor is much the same light fruits with some floral hops and a malty aftertaste with a lot of funkiness to it very belgian like. Easy to drink but wouldnt call it hophead since hops are very absent mostly just funky maltiness and a slight fruitiness to it.
UPDATED: MAY 16, 2014 Funny rating this beer... I didnt give it quite top marks in every area for one reason... theres always room for improvement, isnt there???? Old Cross Tavern, Hertford
Cask. Yellow colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is zest, hops and some caramel. Flavour is grassy hops, some malts and a bit of wood mixed in. Quite harsh and dry.

(cask @ The Old Toad - Rochester, NY) Slightly hazy golden color with a soapy and thick white head. Aroma is rather hoppy with some floral notes and some light citrus. Flavor has a very nice and strong hop flavor and a sweet middle of citrus and a nice and bitter hoppy finish. Alcohol isnt so high that you cant drink a lot of these. Very nice.

Pale yellow color, small white head. Citrus hoppy nose. Flowery, lemony hoppy flavor. Citrus fruityness is nicely balanced with backing malts. Good one.

Aroma was amazing, i perhaps rushed this a little it could have done with another days venting. Citrus lychee mandarin grapefruit touch of lemon, really fuckin good aroma. Taste is not as intence with the hops but seriously refreshing hoppy as fuck, bitter great finish. Just as good as brewers gold.

(Rating 500) Gravity, served by Fin at the Merton BF. Warm gold pour, small but sticky white layer of foam. This is just a gorgeous smelling beer, full of sunny early-summer citrus perfume. Delicate crisp citrus bitterness--a wonderful expression of the hop actually being a flower! A touch of round biscuit warmth in the finish adds depth and balance. Clean, bright palate. An elegant full-flavored but delicately balanced beer. Any fool can brew a hoppy pale beer--it takes an artist to brew something like this.

Cask conditioned at Merton Beer Festival 16-02-07. Poured a golden colour and with a thin bubbly head and looking crystal clear. This beer really was a little belter punching far above its weight it was a real star and the first to run out at the festival by a good few hours. The aroma was excellent and bettered only by the Crouch Vale Amarillo, with a wonderful fresh zesty fruit and hoppiness. The taste delivered far more punch and flavour than you really should expect from a beer with such a low gravity, with a wonderful juicy fruitiness with grapefruit flavours dominating and a lovely hoppy sign off. This really was a great beer and at this strength a good session beer, top marks to Dark Star again for squeezing so much out of such a relatively low abv beer.

Half pint on cask at The Rake, London Bridge. Filmy layer over a pale golden body. Floral to the nose with a taste of hoppy grapefruit mixed with a malty touch towards the end. Firm mouthfeel supported by some hop bitterness towards the end. Moreish, but a bit watery (01.02.2007)

Handpump at the Doric Arch, Euston, Nov 06. Pale beer with small head. Som malty body tries to get to the front, but is briskly elbowed away by the hops. Flowery, gassy, dry, just as I lie them. And at 3.8%, you can have a few!
Old Cross Tavern, Hertford. Lovely citrus aroma and in the taste. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: OCT 23, 2007 Cask @ The Rake pub on opening day. Looks quite attractive, golden yellow with a nice white head but tastes awful. As Im sure you can tell by now Im not a great fan of bitter beers and this both smells and tastes bitter. To be more accurate tasted like a glass of water with hops in it, bland and bitter. Sorry Darkstar, no hard feelings, this just isnt my thing...
Re-rate - Cask @ The Wenlock. Renamed on the board as Dickhead by the locals, lol...Boy, did I have the wrong idea above! Previously rated 6,4,5,3,12. Soapy, grassy hops. Plenty of citrus, grapefruit and lemon meringue. Juicy, bitter hops and citrus all round really. Long, you guessed it, hoppy citrus finish. Refreshing and sessionable, Im so glad my palate has evolved...
Cask at GBBF 2006.  Clear golden colour.  Flowery citric nose. Dry bitter flavour
This brewery has good things, I am not in a bitter club but although its classification, it had a nice bitter taste.

Cask @ Volunteer Arms, GBBF 2006. Pours a clear golden colour with a longlasting white head. Fruity hoppy citrus aroma. Malty fruity and very hoppy flavor with some hints of citrus. Long hoppy bitter aftertaste.
and yet another rating and sample at the GBBF. very nice beer. it was actually the last one we had, which was a good finale.
NERAX 2005 Golden in color with no head. Aroma and flavor of mild bready malt and citrus hops.

(Cask at Oliver Twist, Stockholm, 9 July) Colour is golden with notes of orange, frothy head. Nose is fruity and hoppy with notes of citrus (grapefruit, orange peel), very fresh hop aroma. Taste is hoppy and fruity with notes of grapefruit and a fresh, hoppy finish. Very refreshing.

UPDATED: APR 6, 2007 A Mes rate: Cask at the Head of Steam in Euston. Standard English tobacco nose (I’m sure that’s a song by Edgar Winter!) Crap appearance. Looks just like lager. No head but leaves a surprising amount of lace. Very citric and also very hoppy as the name suggests. Off milk in the nose, watery palate but somehow it is reasonably satisfying. Finish is all bitter hops which gradually fade and then the malt makes an unexpected appearance. A most unusual finish and one which totally makes the beer. However I get the feeling this should be a lot better.

On tap in the Evening Star in Brighton. Light in colour with no head. Again a flat looking ale with no character. However a nice beer. Smooth and a little flavour of hops. Leaves no distinguished taste, quite sweet also.

Cask @ dba.  Very pale golden, topped by a creamy white head.  Nose of clean maris otter malts, orangey hops and some light resinousness.  Fairly simple aroma.  Falvour is also simple, UK malts, pale malt, light orange hops, some resin and an unpleasant soapy astringency that I dont care for.  Meh.

Straw golden colour and slightly pale. Some citrus fruit flavout in a lasting finish.
Cask : The 7 Stars, Holborn. Light yellow, with a lot of hops(as the name suggests) refreshing and easy to drink, good finnish of hops too.
